page.title: 16The Derby Arms at Thornley
page.content:
The Derby Arms was formerly a coaching house and is now a restaurant and public house employing some 20 persons, mostly local and casual. The manager is resident and there is no provision for employing young persons on one of the government schemes. The work force is provided with transport due to the absence of an adequate bus service.
The restaurant provides a venue for wedding receptions and discos. The public bars cater for a small number of regular local people and during the Summer months people from the surrounding areas motor out for an evening drink and perhaps a bar snack.
